body_html:
Thank you @ebrevdo for your continued notes. How does this most recent patch look? Here are the highlights:

  • Changed assertAllClose to assertAllEqual, and removed the check for string data-type. The assertAllClose check was from the initial implementation of the Op, but it's a good catch to change it.
  • All white space changes should be gone
  • Removed the cast on depth in the Python wrapper. Letting depth use the same generic type as indices, TI, doesn't work with the backwards compatibility check. But you're right in that the cast is unnecessary in general
  • Added a default value of DT_INT64 for the generic type TI- this was needed for the test to pass the backwards compatibility test

Let me know if you have anything else!
body_text:
Thank you @ebrevdo for your continued notes. How does this most recent patch look? Here are the highlights:

Changed assertAllClose to assertAllEqual, and removed the check for string data-type. The assertAllClose check was from the initial implementation of the Op, but it's a good catch to change it.
All white space changes should be gone
Removed the cast on depth in the Python wrapper. Letting depth use the same generic type as indices, TI, doesn't work with the backwards compatibility check. But you're right in that the cast is unnecessary in general
Added a default value of DT_INT64 for the generic type TI- this was needed for the test to pass the backwards compatibility test

Let me know if you have anything else!
body:
Thank you @ebrevdo for your continued notes. How does this most recent patch look? Here are the highlights:
- Changed `assertAllClose` to `assertAllEqual`, and removed the check for string data-type. The `assertAllClose` check was from the initial implementation of the Op, but it's a good catch to change it.
- All white space changes should be gone
- Removed the `cast` on depth in the Python wrapper. Letting depth use the same generic type as indices, TI, doesn't work with the backwards compatibility check. But you're right in that the cast is unnecessary in general
- Added a default value of `DT_INT64` for the generic type TI- this was needed for the test to pass the backwards compatibility test

Let me know if you have anything else!
